00042         typedef vector<2, int> Point;
00043     struct Rect
00044     {
00045                 Point min;
00046                 Point max;
00047 
00048                 Rect(): min(0, 0), max(0, 0) {}
00049 
00050                 Rect(const Point& vmin, const Point& vmax):
00051                 min(vmin), max(vmax) {}
00052 
00053                 Rect(int x, int y, int width, int height):
00054                 min(x, y), max(x + width, y + height) {}
00055 
00056                 int width() const { return max(0) - min(0); }
00057                 int height() const { return max(1) - min(1); }
00058 
00059                 int x() const { return min(0); }
00060                 int y() const { return min(1); }
00061     };

00412     template<typename T>
00413     const T Math<T>::PositiveInfinity = std::numeric_limits<T>::infinity();
00414     template<typename T>
00415     const T Math<T>::NegativeInfinity = -std::numeric_limits<T>::infinity();
00416     template<typename T>
00417     const T Math<T>::Pi = T( 4.0 * atan( 1.0 ) );
00418     template<typename T>
00419     const T Math<T>::TwoPi = T( 2.0 * Pi );
00420     template<typename T>
00421     const T Math<T>::HalfPi = T( 0.5 * Pi );
00422     template<typename T>
00423         const T Math<T>::DegToRad = Pi / T(180.0);
00424     template<typename T>
00425         const T Math<T>::RadToDeg = T(180.0) / Pi;
00426     template<typename T>
00427         const T Math<T>::Log2Base = log(T(2.0));

00430     int Math<T>::mTrigTableSize;
00431 
00432     template<typename T>
00433     T  Math<T>::mTrigTableFactor;
00434     template<typename T>
00435     T *Math<T>::mSinTable = NULL;
00436     template<typename T>
00437     T *Math<T>::mTanTable = NULL;
00438 
00440     template<typename T> inline 
00441         Math<T>::Math( unsigned int trigTableSize )
00442     {
00443         mTrigTableSize = trigTableSize;
00444         mTrigTableFactor = mTrigTableSize / Math<T>::TwoPi;
00445 
00446         mSinTable = new T[mTrigTableSize];
00447         mTanTable = new T[mTrigTableSize];
00448 
00449         buildTrigTables();
00450     }
00451 
00453     template<typename T> inline 
00454     Math<T>::~Math()
00455     {
00456                 delete[] mSinTable;
00457                 delete[] mTanTable;
00458                 mSinTable = NULL;
00459                 mTanTable = NULL;
00460     }
00461 
00463     template<typename T> inline 
00464     void Math<T>::buildTrigTables(void)
00465     {
00466         // Build trig lookup tables
00467         // Could get away with building only Pi sized Sin table but simpler this 
00468         // way. Who cares, it'll ony use an extra 8k of memory anyway and I like 
00469         // simplicity.
00470         T angle;
00471         for (int i = 0; i < mTrigTableSize; ++i)
00472         {
00473             angle = Math<T>::TwoPi * i / mTrigTableSize;
00474             mSinTable[i] = sin(angle);
00475             mTanTable[i] = tan(angle);
00476         }
00477     }
00478 
00480     template<typename T> inline 
00481         T Math<T>::SinTable (T fValue)
00482     {
00483         // Convert range to index values, wrap if required
00484         int idx;
00485         if (fValue >= 0)
00486         {
00487             idx = int(fValue * mTrigTableFactor) % mTrigTableSize;
00488         }
00489         else
00490         {
00491             idx = mTrigTableSize - (int(-fValue * mTrigTableFactor) % mTrigTableSize) - 1;
00492         }
00493 
00494         return mSinTable[idx];
00495     }
00496 
00498     template<typename T> inline 
00499         T Math<T>::TanTable (T fValue)
00500     {
00501         // Convert range to index values, wrap if required
00502                 int idx = int(fValue *= mTrigTableFactor) % mTrigTableSize;
00503                 return mTanTable[idx];
00504     }
00505 
00507     template<typename T> inline 
00508     int Math<T>::isign (int iValue)
00509     {
00510         return ( iValue > 0 ? +1 : ( iValue < 0 ? -1 : 0 ) );
00511     }
00512 
00514     template<typename T> inline 
00515     T Math<T>::acos (T fValue)
00516     {
00517         if ( -1.0 < fValue )
00518         {
00519             if ( fValue < 1.0 )
00520                 return acos(fValue);
00521             else
00522                 return 0.0f;
00523         }
00524         else
00525         {
00526             return Pi;
00527         }
00528     }
00529 
00531     template<typename T> inline 
00532     T Math<T>::asin (T fValue)
00533     {
00534         if ( -1.0 < fValue )
00535         {
00536             if ( fValue < 1.0 )
00537                 return asin(fValue);
00538             else
00539                 return HalfPi;
00540         }
00541         else
00542         {
00543             return -HalfPi;
00544         }
00545     }
00546 
00548     template<typename T> inline 
00549     T Math<T>::sign (T fValue)
00550     {
00551         if ( fValue > 0.0 )
00552             return 1.0;
00553 
00554         if ( fValue < 0.0 )
00555             return -1.0;
00556 
00557         return 0.0;
00558     }

00561     template<typename T> inline 
00562     T Math<T>::unitRandom ()
00563         {
00564                 return ((T)rand() / RAND_MAX);
00565         }    
00566 
00568     template<typename T> inline 
00569     T Math<T>::rangeRandom (T fLow, T fHigh)
00570     {
00571         return (fHigh-fLow)*unitRandom() + fLow;
00572     }
00573 
00575     template<typename T> inline 
00576     T Math<T>::symmetricRandom ()
00577     {
00578                 return 2.0f * unitRandom() - 1.0f;
00579     }
00580 
00582     template<typename T> inline 
00583         bool Math<T>::pointInTri2D(const vector<2,T>& p, const vector<2,T>& a, 
00584                 const vector<2,T>& b, const vector<2,T>& c)
00585     {
00586                 // Winding must be consistent from all edges for point to be inside
00587                 vector<2,T> v1, v2;
00588                 T dot[3];
00589                 bool zeroDot[3];
00590 
00591                 v1 = b - a;
00592                 v2 = p - a;
00593 
00594                 // Note we don't care about normalisation here since sign is all we need
00595                 // It means we don't have to worry about magnitude of cross products either
00596                 dot[0] = v1.cross(v2);
00597                 zeroDot[0] = Math<T>::floatEqual(dot[0], 0.0f, 1e-3f);
00598 
00599 
00600                 v1 = c - b;
00601                 v2 = p - b;
00602 
00603                 dot[1] = v1.cross(v2);
00604                 zeroDot[1] = Math<T>::floatEqual(dot[1], 0.0f, 1e-3f);
00605 
00606                 // Compare signs (ignore colinear / coincident points)
00607                 if(!zeroDot[0] && !zeroDot[1] 
00608                 && Math<T>::sign(dot[0]) != Math<T>::sign(dot[1]))
00609                 {
00610                         return false;
00611                 }
00612 
00613                 v1 = a - c;
00614                 v2 = p - c;
00615 
00616                 dot[2] = v1.cross(v2);
00617                 zeroDot[2] = Math<T>::floatEqual(dot[2], 0.0f, 1e-3f);
00618                 // Compare signs (ignore colinear / coincident points)
00619                 if((!zeroDot[0] && !zeroDot[2] 
00620                         && Math<T>::sign(dot[0]) != Math<T>::sign(dot[2])) ||
00621                         (!zeroDot[1] && !zeroDot[2] 
00622                         && Math<T>::sign(dot[1]) != Math<T>::sign(dot[2])))
00623                 {
00624                         return false;
00625                 }
00626 
00627 
00628                 return true;
00629     }
00630 
00632     template<typename T> inline 
00633         bool Math<T>::pointInTri3D(const vector<3,T>& p, const vector<3,T>& a, 
00634                 const vector<3,T>& b, const vector<3,T>& c, const vector<3,T>& normal)
00635         {
00636         // Winding must be consistent from all edges for point to be inside
00637                 vector<3,T> v1, v2;
00638                 T dot[3];
00639                 bool zeroDot[3];
00640 
00641         v1 = b - a;
00642         v2 = p - a;
00643 
00644                 // Note we don't care about normalisation here since sign is all we need
00645                 // It means we don't have to worry about magnitude of cross products either
00646         dot[0] = v1.cross(v2).dot(normal);
00647                 zeroDot[0] = Math<T>::floatEqual(dot[0], 0.0f, 1e-3f);
00648 
00649 
00650         v1 = c - b;
00651         v2 = p - b;
00652 
00653                 dot[1] = v1.cross(v2).dot(normal);
00654                 zeroDot[1] = Math<T>::floatEqual(dot[1], 0.0f, 1e-3f);
00655 
00656                 // Compare signs (ignore colinear / coincident points)
00657                 if(!zeroDot[0] && !zeroDot[1] 
00658                         && Math<T>::sign(dot[0]) != Math<T>::sign(dot[1]))
00659                 {
00660             return false;
00661                 }
00662 
00663         v1 = a - c;
00664         v2 = p - c;
00665 
00666                 dot[2] = v1.cross(v2).dot(normal);
00667                 zeroDot[2] = Math<T>::floatEqual(dot[2], 0.0f, 1e-3f);
00668                 // Compare signs (ignore colinear / coincident points)
00669                 if((!zeroDot[0] && !zeroDot[2] 
00670                         && Math<T>::sign(dot[0]) != Math<T>::sign(dot[2])) ||
00671                         (!zeroDot[1] && !zeroDot[2] 
00672                         && Math<T>::sign(dot[1]) != Math<T>::sign(dot[2])))
00673                 {
00674                         return false;
00675                 }
00676 
00677 
00678         return true;
00679         }
00680 
00682     template<typename T> inline 
00683     bool Math<T>::floatEqual( T a, T b, T tolerance )
00684     {
00685         if (fabs(b-a) <= tolerance)
00686             return true;
00687         else
00688             return false;
00689     }
00690 
00692     template<typename T> inline 
00693     std::pair<bool, T> Math<T>::intersects(const Ray<T>& ray, const Plane<T>& plane)
00694     {
00695 
00696         T denom = plane.normal.dot(ray.getDirection());
00697         if (Math<T>::abs(denom) < std::numeric_limits<T>::epsilon())
00698         {
00699             // Parallel
00700             return std::pair<bool, T>(false, 0);
00701         }
00702         else
00703         {
00704             T nom = plane.normal.dot(ray.getOrigin()) + plane.d;
00705             T t = -(nom/denom);
00706             return std::pair<bool, T>(t >= 0, t);
00707         }
00708         
00709     }
00710 
00712     template<typename T> inline 
00713     std::pair<bool, T> Math<T>::intersects(const Ray<T>& ray, 
00714         const std::vector<Plane<T> >& planes, bool normalIsOutside)
00715     {
00716                 std::list<Plane<T> > planesList;
00717                 for (typename std::vector<Plane<T> >::const_iterator i = planes.begin(); i != planes.end(); ++i)
00718                 {
00719                         planesList.push_back(*i);
00720                 }
00721                 return intersects(ray, planesList, normalIsOutside);
00722     }
00723 
00725     template<typename T> inline 
00726     std::pair<bool, T> Math<T>::intersects(const Ray<T>& ray, 
00727         const std::list<Plane<T> >& planes, bool normalIsOutside)
00728     {
00729                 typename std::list<Plane<T> >::const_iterator planeit, planeitend;
00730                 planeitend = planes.end();
00731                 bool allInside = true;
00732                 std::pair<bool, T> ret;
00733                 std::pair<bool, T> end;
00734                 ret.first = false;
00735                 ret.second = 0.0f;
00736                 end.first = false;
00737                 end.second = 0;
00738 
00739 
00740                 // derive side
00741                 // NB we don't pass directly since that would require Plane<T>::Side in 
00742                 // interface, which results in recursive includes since math is so fundamental
00743                 typename Plane<T>::Side outside = normalIsOutside ? Plane<T>::POSITIVE_SIDE : Plane<T>::NEGATIVE_SIDE;
00744 
00745                 for (planeit = planes.begin(); planeit != planeitend; ++planeit)
00746                 {
00747                         const Plane<T>& plane = *planeit;
00748                         // is origin outside?
00749                         if (plane.getSide(ray.getOrigin()) == outside)
00750                         {
00751                                 allInside = false;
00752                                 // Test single plane
00753                                 std::pair<bool, T> planeRes = 
00754                                         ray.intersects(plane);
00755                                 if (planeRes.first)
00756                                 {
00757                                         // Ok, we intersected
00758                                         ret.first = true;
00759                                         // Use the most distant result since convex volume
00760                                         ret.second = std::max(ret.second, planeRes.second);
00761                                 }
00762                                 else
00763                                 {
00764                                         ret.first =false;
00765                                         ret.second=0.0f;
00766                                         return ret;
00767                                 }
00768                         }
00769                         else
00770                         {
00771                                 std::pair<bool, T> planeRes = 
00772                                         ray.intersects(plane);
00773                                 if (planeRes.first)
00774                                 {
00775                                         if( !end.first )
00776                                         {
00777                                                 end.first = true;
00778                                                 end.second = planeRes.second;
00779                                         }
00780                                         else
00781                                         {
00782                                                 end.second = std::min( planeRes.second, end.second );
00783                                         }
00784 
00785                                 }
00786 
00787                         }
00788                 }
00789 
00790                 if (allInside)
00791                 {
00792                         // Intersecting at 0 distance since inside the volume!
00793                         ret.first = true;
00794                         ret.second = 0.0f;
00795                         return ret;
00796                 }
00797 
00798                 if( end.first )
00799                 {
00800                         if( end.second < ret.second )
00801                         {
00802                                 ret.first = false;
00803                                 return ret;
00804                         }
00805                 }
00806                 return ret;
00807     }
00808 
00810     template<typename T> inline 
00811     std::pair<bool, T> Math<T>::intersects(const Ray<T>& ray, const Sphere<T>& sphere, 
00812         bool discardInside)
00813     {
00814         const vector<3,T>& raydir = ray.getDirection();
00815         // Adjust ray origin relative to sphere center
00816         const vector<3,T>& rayorig = ray.getOrigin() - sphere.getCenter();
00817         T radius = sphere.getRadius();
00818 
00819         // Check origin inside first
00820         if (rayorig.squaredNorm() <= radius*radius && discardInside)
00821         {
00822             return std::pair<bool, T>(true, 0);
00823         }
00824 
00825         // Mmm, quadratics
00826         // Build coeffs which can be used with std quadratic solver
00827         // ie t = (-b +/- sqrt(b*b + 4ac)) / 2a
00828         T a = raydir.dot(raydir);
00829         T b = 2 * rayorig.dot(raydir);
00830         T c = rayorig.dot(rayorig) - radius*radius;
00831 
00832         // Calc determinant
00833         T d = (b*b) - (4 * a * c);
00834         if (d < 0)
00835         {
00836             // No intersection
00837             return std::pair<bool, T>(false, 0);
00838         }
00839         else
00840         {
00841             // BTW, if d=0 there is one intersection, if d > 0 there are 2
00842             // But we only want the closest one, so that's ok, just use the 
00843             // '-' version of the solver
00844             T t = ( -b - Math<T>::sqrt(d) ) / (2 * a);
00845             if (t < 0)
00846                 t = ( -b + Math<T>::sqrt(d) ) / (2 * a);
00847             return std::pair<bool, T>(true, t);
00848         }
00849 
00850 
00851     }
00852 
00854     template<typename T> inline 
00855         std::pair<bool, T> Math<T>::intersects(const Ray<T>& ray, const AlignedBox3<T>& box)
00856         {
00857                 if (box.isNull()) return std::pair<bool, T>(false, 0);
00858                 if (box.isInfinite()) return std::pair<bool, T>(true, 0);
00859 
00860                 T lowt = 0.0f;
00861                 T t;
00862                 bool hit = false;
00863                 vector<3,T> hitpoint;
00864                 const vector<3,T>& min = box.getMinimum();
00865                 const vector<3,T>& max = box.getMaximum();
00866                 const vector<3,T>& rayorig = ray.getOrigin();
00867                 const vector<3,T>& raydir = ray.getDirection();
00868 
00869                 // Check origin inside first
00870                 if ( (rayorig.array()  > min.array()).all() && (rayorig.array() < max.array()).all() )
00871                 {
00872                         return std::pair<bool, T>(true, 0);
00873                 }
00874 
00875                 // Check each face in turn, only check closest 3
00876                 // Min x
00877                 if (rayorig.x() <= min.x() && raydir.x() > 0)
00878                 {
00879                         t = (min.x() - rayorig.x()) / raydir.x();
00880                         if (t >= 0)
00881                         {
00882                                 // Substitute t back into ray and check bounds and dist
00883                                 hitpoint = rayorig + raydir * t;
00884                                 if (hitpoint.y() >= min.y() && hitpoint.y() <= max.y() &&
00885                                         hitpoint.z() >= min.z() && hitpoint.z() <= max.z() &&
00886                                         (!hit || t < lowt))
00887                                 {
00888                                         hit = true;
00889                                         lowt = t;
00890                                 }
00891                         }
00892                 }
00893                 // Max x
00894                 if (rayorig.x() >= max.x() && raydir.x() < 0)
00895                 {
00896                         t = (max.x() - rayorig.x()) / raydir.x();
00897                         if (t >= 0)
00898                         {
00899                                 // Substitute t back into ray and check bounds and dist
00900                                 hitpoint = rayorig + raydir * t;
00901                                 if (hitpoint.y() >= min.y() && hitpoint.y() <= max.y() &&
00902                                         hitpoint.z() >= min.z() && hitpoint.z() <= max.z() &&
00903                                         (!hit || t < lowt))
00904                                 {
00905                                         hit = true;
00906                                         lowt = t;
00907                                 }
00908                         }
00909                 }
00910                 // Min y
00911                 if (rayorig.y() <= min.y() && raydir.y() > 0)
00912                 {
00913                         t = (min.y() - rayorig.y()) / raydir.y();
00914                         if (t >= 0)
00915                         {
00916                                 // Substitute t back into ray and check bounds and dist
00917                                 hitpoint = rayorig + raydir * t;
00918                                 if (hitpoint.x() >= min.x() && hitpoint.x() <= max.x() &&
00919                                         hitpoint.z() >= min.z() && hitpoint.z() <= max.z() &&
00920                                         (!hit || t < lowt))
00921                                 {
00922                                         hit = true;
00923                                         lowt = t;
00924                                 }
00925                         }
00926                 }
00927                 // Max y
00928                 if (rayorig.y() >= max.y() && raydir.y() < 0)
00929                 {
00930                         t = (max.y() - rayorig.y()) / raydir.y();
00931                         if (t >= 0)
00932                         {
00933                                 // Substitute t back into ray and check bounds and dist
00934                                 hitpoint = rayorig + raydir * t;
00935                                 if (hitpoint.x() >= min.x() && hitpoint.x() <= max.x() &&
00936                                         hitpoint.z() >= min.z() && hitpoint.z() <= max.z() &&
00937                                         (!hit || t < lowt))
00938                                 {
00939                                         hit = true;
00940                                         lowt = t;
00941                                 }
00942                         }
00943                 }
00944                 // Min z
00945                 if (rayorig.z() <= min.z() && raydir.z() > 0)
00946                 {
00947                         t = (min.z() - rayorig.z()) / raydir.z();
00948                         if (t >= 0)
00949                         {
00950                                 // Substitute t back into ray and check bounds and dist
00951                                 hitpoint = rayorig + raydir * t;
00952                                 if (hitpoint.x() >= min.x() && hitpoint.x() <= max.x() &&
00953                                         hitpoint.y() >= min.y() && hitpoint.y() <= max.y() &&
00954                                         (!hit || t < lowt))
00955                                 {
00956                                         hit = true;
00957                                         lowt = t;
00958                                 }
00959                         }
00960                 }
00961                 // Max z
00962                 if (rayorig.z() >= max.z() && raydir.z() < 0)
00963                 {
00964                         t = (max.z() - rayorig.z()) / raydir.z();
00965                         if (t >= 0)
00966                         {
00967                                 // Substitute t back into ray and check bounds and dist
00968                                 hitpoint = rayorig + raydir * t;
00969                                 if (hitpoint.x() >= min.x() && hitpoint.x() <= max.x() &&
00970                                         hitpoint.y() >= min.y() && hitpoint.y() <= max.y() &&
00971                                         (!hit || t < lowt))
00972                                 {
00973                                         hit = true;
00974                                         lowt = t;
00975                                 }
00976                         }
00977                 }
00978 
00979                 return std::pair<bool, T>(hit, lowt);
00980 
00981         } 
00982 
00984     template<typename T> inline 
00985     bool Math<T>::intersects(const Ray<T>& ray, const AlignedBox3<T>& box,
00986         T* d1, T* d2)
00987     {
00988         if (box.isNull())
00989             return false;
00990 
00991         if (box.isInfinite())
00992         {
00993             if (d1) *d1 = 0;
00994             if (d2) *d2 = Math<T>::PositiveInfinity;
00995             return true;
00996         }
00997 
00998         const vector<3,T>& min = box.getMinimum();
00999         const vector<3,T>& max = box.getMaximum();
01000         const vector<3,T>& rayorig = ray.getOrigin();
01001         const vector<3,T>& raydir = ray.getDirection();
01002 
01003         vector<3,T> absDir;
01004         absDir[0] = Math<T>::abs(raydir[0]);
01005         absDir[1] = Math<T>::abs(raydir[1]);
01006         absDir[2] = Math<T>::abs(raydir[2]);
01007 
01008         // Sort the axis, ensure check minimise floating error axis first
01009         int imax = 0, imid = 1, imin = 2;
01010         if (absDir[0] < absDir[2])
01011         {
01012             imax = 2;
01013             imin = 0;
01014         }
01015         if (absDir[1] < absDir[imin])
01016         {
01017             imid = imin;
01018             imin = 1;
01019         }
01020         else if (absDir[1] > absDir[imax])
01021         {
01022             imid = imax;
01023             imax = 1;
01024         }
01025 
01026         T start = 0, end = Math<T>::PositiveInfinity;
01027 
01028 #define _CALC_AXIS(i)                                       \
01029     do {                                                    \
01030         T denom = 1 / raydir[i];                         \
01031         T newstart = (min[i] - rayorig[i]) * denom;      \
01032         T newend = (max[i] - rayorig[i]) * denom;        \
01033         if (newstart > newend) std::swap(newstart, newend); \
01034         if (newstart > end || newend < start) return false; \
01035         if (newstart > start) start = newstart;             \
01036         if (newend < end) end = newend;                     \
01037     } while(0)
01038 
01039         // Check each axis in turn
01040 
01041         _CALC_AXIS(imax);
01042 
01043         if (absDir[imid] < std::numeric_limits<T>::epsilon())
01044         {
01045             // Parallel with middle and minimise axis, check bounds only
01046             if (rayorig[imid] < min[imid] || rayorig[imid] > max[imid] ||
01047                 rayorig[imin] < min[imin] || rayorig[imin] > max[imin])
01048                 return false;
01049         }
01050         else
01051         {
01052             _CALC_AXIS(imid);
01053 
01054             if (absDir[imin] < std::numeric_limits<T>::epsilon())
01055             {
01056                 // Parallel with minimise axis, check bounds only
01057                 if (rayorig[imin] < min[imin] || rayorig[imin] > max[imin])
01058                     return false;
01059             }
01060             else
01061             {
01062                 _CALC_AXIS(imin);
01063             }
01064         }
01065 #undef _CALC_AXIS
01066 
01067         if (d1) *d1 = start;
01068         if (d2) *d2 = end;
01069 
01070         return true;
01071     }
01072 
01074     template<typename T> inline 
01075     std::pair<bool, T> Math<T>::intersects(const Ray<T>& ray, const vector<3,T>& a,
01076         const vector<3,T>& b, const vector<3,T>& c, const vector<3,T>& normal,
01077         bool positiveSide, bool negativeSide)
01078     {
01079         //
01080         // Calculate intersection with plane.
01081         //
01082         T t;
01083         {
01084             T denom = normal.dot(ray.getDirection());
01085 
01086             // Check intersect side
01087             if (denom > + std::numeric_limits<T>::epsilon())
01088             {
01089                 if (!negativeSide)
01090                     return std::pair<bool, T>(false, 0);
01091             }
01092             else if (denom < - std::numeric_limits<T>::epsilon())
01093             {
01094                 if (!positiveSide)
01095                     return std::pair<bool, T>(false, 0);
01096             }
01097             else
01098             {
01099                 // Parallel or triangle area is close to zero when
01100                 // the plane normal not normalized.
01101                 return std::pair<bool, T>(false, 0);
01102             }
01103 
01104             t = normal.dot(a - ray.getOrigin()) / denom;
01105 
01106             if (t < 0)
01107             {
01108                 // Intersection is behind origin
01109                 return std::pair<bool, T>(false, 0);
01110             }
01111         }
01112 
01113         //
01114         // Calculate the largest area projection plane in X, Y or Z.
01115         //
01116         size_t i0, i1;
01117         {
01118             T n0 = Math<T>::abs(normal[0]);
01119             T n1 = Math<T>::abs(normal[1]);
01120             T n2 = Math<T>::abs(normal[2]);
01121 
01122             i0 = 1; i1 = 2;
01123             if (n1 > n2)
01124             {
01125                 if (n1 > n0) i0 = 0;
01126             }
01127             else
01128             {
01129                 if (n2 > n0) i1 = 0;
01130             }
01131         }
01132 
01133         //
01134         // Check the intersection point is inside the triangle.
01135         //
01136         {
01137             T u1 = b[i0] - a[i0];
01138             T v1 = b[i1] - a[i1];
01139             T u2 = c[i0] - a[i0];
01140             T v2 = c[i1] - a[i1];
01141             T u0 = t * ray.getDirection()[i0] + ray.getOrigin()[i0] - a[i0];
01142             T v0 = t * ray.getDirection()[i1] + ray.getOrigin()[i1] - a[i1];
01143 
01144             T alpha = u0 * v2 - u2 * v0;
01145             T beta  = u1 * v0 - u0 * v1;
01146             T area  = u1 * v2 - u2 * v1;
01147 
01148             // epsilon to avoid T precision error
01149             const T EPSILON = 1e-6f;
01150 
01151             T tolerance = - EPSILON * area;
01152 
01153             if (area > 0)
01154             {
01155                 if (alpha < tolerance || beta < tolerance || alpha+beta > area-tolerance)
01156                     return std::pair<bool, T>(false, 0);
01157             }
01158             else
01159             {
01160                 if (alpha > tolerance || beta > tolerance || alpha+beta < area-tolerance)
01161                     return std::pair<bool, T>(false, 0);
01162             }
01163         }
01164 
01165         return std::pair<bool, T>(true, t);
01166     }
01167 
01169     template<typename T> inline 
01170     std::pair<bool, T> Math<T>::intersects(const Ray<T>& ray, const vector<3,T>& a,
01171         const vector<3,T>& b, const vector<3,T>& c,
01172         bool positiveSide, bool negativeSide)
01173     {
01174         vector<3,T> normal = calculateBasicFaceNormalWithoutNormalize(a, b, c);
01175         return intersects(ray, a, b, c, normal, positiveSide, negativeSide);
01176     }
01177 
01179     template<typename T> inline 
01180     bool Math<T>::intersects(const Sphere<T>& sphere, const AlignedBox3<T>& box)
01181     {
01182         if (box.isNull()) return false;
01183         if (box.isInfinite()) return true;
01184 
01185         // Use splitting planes
01186         const vector<3,T>& center = sphere.getCenter();
01187         T radius = sphere.getRadius();
01188         const vector<3,T>& min = box.getMinimum();
01189         const vector<3,T>& max = box.getMaximum();
01190 
01191                 // Arvo's algorithm
01192                 T s, d = 0;
01193                 for (int i = 0; i < 3; ++i)
01194                 {
01195                         if (center[i] < min[i])
01196                         {
01197                                 s = center[i] - min[i];
01198                                 d += s * s; 
01199                         }
01200                         else if(center[i] > max[i])
01201                         {
01202                                 s = center[i] - max[i];
01203                                 d += s * s; 
01204                         }
01205                 }
01206                 return d <= radius * radius;
01207 
01208     }
01209 
01211     template<typename T> inline 
01212     bool Math<T>::intersects(const Plane<T>& plane, const AlignedBox3<T>& box)
01213     {
01214         return (plane.getSide(box) == BOTH_SIDE);
01215     }
01216 
01218     template<typename T> inline 
01219     bool Math<T>::intersects(const Sphere<T>& sphere, const Plane<T>& plane)
01220     {
01221         return (
01222             Math<T>::abs(plane.getDistance(sphere.getCenter()))
01223             <= sphere.getRadius() );
01224     }
01225 
01227     template<typename T> inline 
01228     vector<3,T> Math<T>::calculateTangentSpaceVector(
01229         const vector<3,T>& position1, const vector<3,T>& position2, const vector<3,T>& position3,
01230         T u1, T v1, T u2, T v2, T u3, T v3)
01231     {
01232             //side0 is the vector along one side of the triangle of vertices passed in, 
01233             //and side1 is the vector along another side. Taking the cross product of these returns the normal.
01234             vector<3,T> side0 = position1 - position2;
01235             vector<3,T> side1 = position3 - position1;
01236             //Calculate face normal
01237             vector<3,T> normal = side1.cross(side0);
01238             normal.normalize();
01239             //Now we use a formula to calculate the tangent. 
01240             T deltaV0 = v1 - v2;
01241             T deltaV1 = v3 - v1;
01242             vector<3,T> tangent = deltaV1 * side0 - deltaV0 * side1;
01243             tangent.normalize();
01244             //Calculate binormal
01245             T deltaU0 = u1 - u2;
01246             T deltaU1 = u3 - u1;
01247             vector<3,T> binormal = deltaU1 * side0 - deltaU0 * side1;
01248             binormal.normalize();
01249             //Now, we take the cross product of the tangents to get a vector which 
01250             //should point in the same direction as our normal calculated above. 
01251             //If it points in the opposite direction (the dot product between the normals is less than zero), 
01252             //then we need to reverse the s and t tangents. 
01253             //This is because the triangle has been mirrored when going from tangent space to object space.
01254             //reverse tangents if necessary
01255             vector<3,T> tangentCross = tangent.cross(binormal);
01256             if (tangentCross.dot(normal) < 0.0f)
01257             {
01258                     tangent = -tangent;
01259                     binormal = -binormal;
01260             }
01261 
01262         return tangent;
01263 
01264     }
01265     //-----------------------------------------------------------------------
01266     //matrix<4,4,T> Math<T>::buildReflectionMatrix(const Plane<T>& p)
01267     //{
01268     //    return matrix<4,4,T>(
01269     //        -2 * p.normal.x() * p.normal.x() + 1,   -2 * p.normal.x() * p.normal.y(),       -2 * p.normal.x() * p.normal.z(),       -2 * p.normal.x() * p.d, 
01270     //        -2 * p.normal.y() * p.normal.x(),       -2 * p.normal.y() * p.normal.y() + 1,   -2 * p.normal.y() * p.normal.z(),       -2 * p.normal.y() * p.d, 
01271     //        -2 * p.normal.z() * p.normal.x(),       -2 * p.normal.z() * p.normal.y(),       -2 * p.normal.z() * p.normal.z() + 1,   -2 * p.normal.z() * p.d, 
01272     //        0,                                  0,                                  0,                                  1);
01273     //}
01275     template<typename T> inline 
01276     vector<4,T> Math<T>::calculateFaceNormal(const vector<3,T>& v1, const vector<3,T>& v2, const vector<3,T>& v3)
01277     {
01278         vector<3,T> normal = calculateBasicFaceNormal(v1, v2, v3);
01279         // Now set up the w (distance of tri from origin
01280         return vector<4,T>(normal.x(), normal.y(), normal.z(), -(normal.dot(v1)));
01281     }
01282 
01284     template<typename T> inline 
01285     vector<3,T> Math<T>::calculateBasicFaceNormal(const vector<3,T>& v1, const vector<3,T>& v2, const vector<3,T>& v3)
01286     {
01287         vector<3,T> normal = (v2 - v1).cross(v3 - v1);
01288         normal.normalize();
01289         return normal;
01290     }
01291 
01293     template<typename T> inline 
01294     vector<4,T> Math<T>::calculateFaceNormalWithoutNormalize(const vector<3,T>& v1, const vector<3,T>& v2, const vector<3,T>& v3)
01295     {
01296         vector<3,T> normal = calculateBasicFaceNormalWithoutNormalize(v1, v2, v3);
01297         // Now set up the w (distance of tri from origin)
01298         return vector<4,T>(normal.x(), normal.y(), normal.z(), -(normal.dot(v1)));
01299     }
01300 
01302     template<typename T> inline 
01303     vector<3,T> Math<T>::calculateBasicFaceNormalWithoutNormalize(const vector<3,T>& v1, const vector<3,T>& v2, const vector<3,T>& v3)
01304     {
01305         vector<3,T> normal = (v2 - v1).cross(v3 - v1);
01306         return normal;
01307     }
01308 
01310     template<typename T> inline 
01311         T Math<T>::gaussianDistribution(T x, T offset, T scale)
01312         {
01313                 T nom = Math<T>::exp(
01314                         -Math<T>::sqr(x - offset) / (2 * Math<T>::sqr(scale)));
01315                 T denom = scale * Math<T>::sqrt(2 * Math<T>::Pi);
01316 
01317                 return nom / denom;
01318 
01319         }
01320         
01322     template<typename T> inline 
01323         transform<3, T, Eigen::Affine> Math<T>::makeViewMatrix(const vector<3,T>& position, const quaternion<T>& orientation)
01324         {
01325                 transform<3, T, Eigen::Affine> viewMatrix;
01326 
01327                 // View matrix is:
01328                 //
01329                 //  [ Lx  Uy  Dz  Tx  ]
01330                 //  [ Lx  Uy  Dz  Ty  ]
01331                 //  [ Lx  Uy  Dz  Tz  ]
01332                 //  [ 0   0   0   1   ]
01333                 //
01334                 // Where T = -(Transposed(Rot) * Pos)
01335 
01336                 // This is most efficiently done using 3x3 Matrices
01337                 matrix<3,3,T> rot = orientation.toRotationMatrix();
01338                 
01339                 //orientation.get_rotation_matrix(rot);
01340                 //rot = orientation;
01341 
01342                 // Make the translation relative to new axes
01343                 matrix<3,3,T> rotT;
01344                 rotT = rot.transpose();
01345                 vector<3,T> trans = -rotT * position;
01346 
01347                 // Make final matrix
01348                 viewMatrix = matrix<4,4,T>::Identity();
01349                 viewMatrix = rotT; // fills upper 3x3
01350                 viewMatrix(0, 3) = trans.x();
01351                 viewMatrix(1, 3) = trans.y();
01352                 viewMatrix(2, 3) = trans.z();
01353                 viewMatrix(3, 3) = 1.0f;
01354 
01355                 return viewMatrix;
01356 
01357         }
01358 
01360     template<typename T>
01361         inline matrix<4,4,T> Math<T>::makePerspectiveMatrix(float fov, float a, float n, float f)
01362         {
01363                 matrix<4,4,T> m = matrix<4,4,T>::Zero();
01364                 float e = 1.0f / tan(fov / 2);
01365 
01366                 m(0,0) = e;
01367                 m(1,1) = e / a;
01368                 m(2,2) = - (f + n) / (f - n);
01369                 m(2,3) = - (2 * f * n) / (f - n);
01370                 m(3,2) = -1;
01371 
01372                 return m;
01373         }
01374 
01376     template<typename T> inline 
01377         T Math<T>::boundingRadiusFromAABB(const AlignedBox3<T>& aabb)
01378         {
01379                 vector<3,T> max = aabb.getMaximum();
01380                 vector<3,T> min = aabb.getMinimum();
01381 
01382                 vector<3,T> magnitude = max;
01383                 magnitude.makeCeil(-max);
01384                 magnitude.makeCeil(min);
01385                 magnitude.makeCeil(-min);
01386 
01387                 return magnitude.length();
01388         }
01389 
01398     template<typename T> inline 
01399         quaternion<T> Math<T>::buildRotation(const vector<3,T>& a, const vector<3,T>& b,
01400                 const vector<3,T>& fallbackAxis)
01401         {
01402                 // Based on Stan Melax's article in Game Programming Gems
01403                 quaternion<T> q;
01404                 // Copy, since cannot modify local
01405                 vector<3,T> v0 = a;
01406                 vector<3,T> v1 = b;
01407                 v0.normalize();
01408                 v1.normalize();
01409 
01410                 T d = v0.dot(v1);
01411                 // If dot == 1, vectors are the same
01412                 if (d >= 1.0f)
01413                 {
01414                         return quaternion<T>::Identity();
01415                 }
01416                 if (d < (1e-6f - 1.0f))
01417                 {
01418                         if (fallbackAxis != vector<3,T>::Zero())
01419                         {
01420                                 // rotate 180 degrees about the fallback axis
01421                                 q = Eigen::AngleAxis<T>(Math<T>::Pi, fallbackAxis);
01422                         }
01423                         else
01424                         {
01425                                 // Generate an axis
01426                                 vector<3,T> axis = vector<3,T>::UnitX().cross(a);
01427                                 if (axis.norm() == 0) // pick another if colinear
01428                                         axis = vector<3,T>::UnitY().cross(a);
01429                                 axis.normalize();
01430                                 q = Eigen::AngleAxis<T>(Math<T>::Pi, axis);
01431                         }
01432                 }
01433                 else
01434                 {
01435                         T s = Math<T>::sqrt( (1+d)*2 );
01436                         T invs = 1 / s;
01437 
01438                         vector<3,T> c = v0.cross(v1);
01439 
01440                 q.x() = c.x() * invs;
01441                         q.y() = c.y() * invs;
01442                         q.z() = c.z() * invs;
01443                         q.w() = s * 0.5f;
01444                         q.normalize();
01445                 }
01446                 return q;
01447         }
01448 
01450     template<typename T> inline 
01451         Ray<T> Math<T>::unproject(
01452                 const vector<2, float>& point, const transform<3, T, Eigen::Affine>& modelview, 
01453                 const transform<3, T, Eigen::Projective>& projection, const Rect& viewport, float z)
01454         {
01455                 vector<3, T> origin;
01456                 vector<3, T> direction;
01457 
01458                 matrix<4, 4, T> A = projection.matrix() * modelview.matrix();
01459                 matrix<4, 4, T> m;
01460                 m = A.inverse();
01461                 //if(!A.inverse(m)) return Ray<T>();
01462 
01463                 vector<4, T> in;
01464                 in[0]=(point[0] - (float)viewport.x()) / (float)(viewport.width()) * 2.0f - 1.0f;
01465         in[1]=((viewport.height() - point[1]) - (float)viewport.y()) / (float)(viewport.height()) * 2.0f - 1.0f;
01466         in[2]= -1.0f;
01467         in[3]=1.0f;
01468 
01469                 vector<4, T> m1 = m * in;
01470                 m1 = m1 / m1[3];
01471 
01472         in[2] = 1.0f;
01473                 vector<4, T> m2 = m * in;
01474                 m2 = m2 / m2[3];
01475 
01476                 float t = (z - m1[2]) / (m2[2] - m1[2]);
01477                 origin[0] = m1[0] + t * (m2[0] - m1[0]);
01478                 origin[1] = m1[1] + t * (m2[1] - m1[1]);
01479                 origin[2] = z;
01480 
01481                 direction = vector<3, T>((m2[0] - m1[0]), (m2[1] - m1[1]), (m2[2] - m1[2]));
01482                 direction.normalize();
01483                 //direction *= -1;
01484 
01485                 return Ray<T>(origin, direction);
01486         }
01487 
01489         template< typename T >
01490         vector<3, float> Math<T>::project(
01491                 const vector<3, float>& point, const transform<3, T, Eigen::Affine>& mmodelview, 
01492                 const transform<3, T, Eigen::Projective>& mprojection, const Rect& rviewport)
01493         {
01494                    const float* modelview = mmodelview.data();
01495                    const float* projection = mprojection.data();
01496                    float viewport[4];
01497 
01498                    viewport[0] = rviewport.x();
01499                    viewport[1] = rviewport.y();
01500                    viewport[2] = rviewport.width();
01501                    viewport[3] = rviewport.height();
01502 
01503                    float objx = point[0];
01504                    float objy = point[1];
01505                    float objz = point[2];
01506 
01507                    vector<3, float> windowCoordinate;
01508 
01509                   //Transformation vectors
01510                   float fTempo[8];
01511                   //Modelview transform
01512                   fTempo[0]=modelview[0]*objx+modelview[4]*objy+modelview[8]*objz+modelview[12];  //w is always 1
01513                   fTempo[1]=modelview[1]*objx+modelview[5]*objy+modelview[9]*objz+modelview[13];
01514                   fTempo[2]=modelview[2]*objx+modelview[6]*objy+modelview[10]*objz+modelview[14];
01515                   fTempo[3]=modelview[3]*objx+modelview[7]*objy+modelview[11]*objz+modelview[15];
01516                   //Projection transform, the final row of projection matrix is always [0 0 -1 0]
01517                   //so we optimize for that.
01518                   fTempo[4]=projection[0]*fTempo[0]+projection[4]*fTempo[1]+projection[8]*fTempo[2]+projection[12]*fTempo[3];
01519                   fTempo[5]=projection[1]*fTempo[0]+projection[5]*fTempo[1]+projection[9]*fTempo[2]+projection[13]*fTempo[3];
01520                   fTempo[6]=projection[2]*fTempo[0]+projection[6]*fTempo[1]+projection[10]*fTempo[2]+projection[14]*fTempo[3];
01521                   fTempo[7]=-fTempo[2];
01522                   //The result normalizes between -1 and 1
01523                   //if(fTempo[7]==0.0)  //The w value
01524                   // return 0;
01525                   fTempo[7]=1.0/fTempo[7];
01526                   //Perspective division
01527                   fTempo[4]*=fTempo[7];
01528                   fTempo[5]*=fTempo[7];
01529                   fTempo[6]*=fTempo[7];
01530                   //Window coordinates
01531                   //Map x, y to range 0-1
01532                   windowCoordinate[0]=(fTempo[4]*0.5+0.5)*viewport[2]+viewport[0];
01533                   windowCoordinate[1]=viewport[3] - (fTempo[5]*0.5+0.5)*viewport[3]+viewport[1];
01534                   //This is only correct when glDepthRange(0.0, 1.0)
01535                   windowCoordinate[2]=(1.0+fTempo[6])*0.5;      //Between 0 and 1
01536                   return windowCoordinate;
01537         }
01538 
01540         template< typename T >
01541         vector< 3, T > Math<T>::normal(
01542             const vector< 3, T >& aa, 
01543                 const vector< 3, T >& bb, 
01544                 const vector< 3, T >& cc
01545                 ) 
01546         {
01547                 vector< 3, T > u,v,tmp;
01548                 // right hand system, CCW triangle
01549                 u = bb - aa;
01550                 v = cc - aa;
01551 
01552                 tmp = u.cross(v);
01553                 tmp.normalize();
01554                 return tmp;
01555         }
01556 
01558         template< typename T >
01559         transform< 3, T, Eigen::Affine > Math<T>::computeMatchingPointsTransform(
01560                 const matrix< 3, Eigen::Dynamic >& src, 
01561                 const matrix< 3, Eigen::Dynamic >& dst)
01562         {
01563                 matrix<4, 4, T> result = Eigen::umeyama(src, dst);
01564                 return result;
01565         }
01566 
01568         template< typename T >
01569         void Math<T>::swapMinMax(T& min, T& max)
01570         {
01571                 if(min > max)
01572                 {
01573                         float tmp = min;
01574                         min = max;
01575                         max = tmp;
01576                 }
01577         }
01578 } // namespace eigenwrap
01579 }
01580 #endif
